meanings.definition: The art or practice of designing and constructing buildings.
meanings.sent1: The architecture of the ancient temple was truly magnificent.
meanings.sent2: The city's unique architecture attracts tourists from all over the world.
meanings.sent3: The architecture of the sandcastle was so elaborate that it looked like a miniature palace.
meanings.sent4: Her mind's architecture was a complex maze of memories and emotions.
meanings.sent5: The architecture of the spider's web was a delicate masterpiece of nature.

meanings.definition: The style and method of design and construction of buildings and other physical structures.
meanings.sent1: Modern architecture often incorporates sustainable materials and innovative designs.
meanings.sent2: The Gothic architecture of the cathedral is breathtaking in its grandeur.
meanings.sent3: The architecture of the treehouse was so unique that it seemed to defy gravity.
meanings.sent4: The architecture of the bridge symbolized strength and connection.
meanings.sent5: The architecture of the beehive displayed perfect symmetry and efficiency.

meanings.definition: The structure or organization of something.
meanings.sent1: The architecture of the company's hierarchy was clearly defined.
meanings.sent2: The architecture of the argument followed a logical progression.
meanings.sent3: The architecture of the ant colony's tunnels was a marvel of teamwork.
meanings.sent4: The architecture of the novel's plot kept readers engaged until the end.
meanings.sent5: The architecture of the ecosystem ensured a delicate balance of species.
